radiographic_examinations.findings: Heterogeneously enhancing T1â€“3 extramedullary lesion, eccentric to the left, with dumbell-like extension out of the neural foramina at T-1 and T-2, encasing the left subclavian artery and brachial plexus, extending locally into the apex of the left lung.

Multilobular T-2 hyperintense heterogeneously enhancing mass that filled the left hemithorax, extended superiorly to encase the left subclavian artery and brachial plexus, involved the left supraclavicular fossa, extending from C-6 to T-2, displacing the trachea and mediastinum to the right with massive compression of the left lung.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Tumor continued to enlarge despite chemotherapy and radiotherapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Demonstrated no intracranial disease other than an incidental small left posterior fossa arachnoid cyst.
